   20: %% Description: Tests supervisor.erl
   21: 
   22: -module(supervisor_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: %% Testserver specific export
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, init_per_testcase/2,
   29: 	 end_per_testcase/2]).
   30: 
   31: %% Internal export
   32: -export([init/1, terminate_all_children/1,
   33:          middle9212/0, gen_server9212/0, handle_info/2, start_registered_name/1, log/2]).
   34: 
   35: %% API tests
   36: -export([ sup_start_normal/1, sup_start_ignore_init/1, 
   37: 	  sup_start_ignore_child/1, sup_start_ignore_temporary_child/1,
   38: 	  sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child/1,
   39: 	  sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child_simple/1,
   40:           sup_start_ignore_permanent_child_start_child_simple/1,
   41: 	  sup_start_error_return/1, sup_start_fail/1,
   42:           sup_start_child_returns_error/1,
   43:           sup_start_restart_child_returns_error/1,
   44:           sup_start_child_returns_error_simple/1,
   45: 	  sup_start_map/1, sup_start_map_simple/1,
   46: 	  sup_start_map_faulty_specs/1,
   47: 	  sup_stop_infinity/1, sup_stop_timeout/1, sup_stop_timeout_dynamic/1,
   48: 	  sup_stop_brutal_kill/1, sup_stop_brutal_kill_dynamic/1,
   49:           sup_stop_race/1, sup_stop_non_shutdown_exit_dynamic/1,
   50: 	  sup_stop_manual/1, sup_stop_manual_timeout/1,
   51: 	  child_adm/1, child_adm_simple/1, child_specs/1, child_specs_map/1,
   52: 	  extra_return/1, sup_flags/1]).
   53: 
   54: %% Tests concept permanent, transient and temporary 
   55: -export([external_start_no_progress_log/1, 
   56:          permanent_normal/1, transient_normal/1, temporary_normal/1,
   57:          permanent_shutdown/1, transient_shutdown/1, temporary_shutdown/1,
   58:          faulty_application_shutdown/1,
   59:          permanent_abnormal/1, transient_abnormal/1,
   60:          temporary_abnormal/1, temporary_bystander/1]).
   61: 
   62: %% Restart strategy tests 
   63: -export([ multiple_restarts/1,
   64: 	  one_for_one/1,
   65: 	  one_for_one_escalation/1, one_for_all/1,
   66: 	  one_for_all_escalation/1, one_for_all_other_child_fails_restart/1,
   67: 	  simple_one_for_one/1, simple_one_for_one_escalation/1,
   68:           simple_one_for_one_corruption/1,
   69: 	  rest_for_one/1, rest_for_one_escalation/1,
   70: 	  rest_for_one_other_child_fails_restart/1,
   71: 	  simple_one_for_one_extra/1, simple_one_for_one_shutdown/1,
   72:           simple_one_for_one_restart_ignore/1]).
   73: 
   74: %% Significant child tests
   75: -export([ nonsignificant_temporary/1, nonsignificant_transient/1,
   76: 	  significant_temporary/1, significant_transient/1,
   77: 	  significant_simple/1, significant_bystander/1,
   78: 	  significant_escalation/1, significant_upgrade_never_any/1,
   79: 	  significant_upgrade_any_never/1, significant_upgrade_never_all/1,
   80: 	  significant_upgrade_all_never/1, significant_upgrade_any_all/1,
   81: 	  significant_upgrade_all_any/1, significant_upgrade_child/1]).
   82: 
   83: %% Misc tests
   84: -export([child_unlink/1, tree/1, count_children/1, count_children_supervisor/1,
   85: 	 count_restarting_children/1, get_callback_module/1,
   86: 	 do_not_save_start_parameters_for_temporary_children/1,
   87: 	 do_not_save_child_specs_for_temporary_children/1,
   88: 	 simple_one_for_one_scale_many_temporary_children/1,
   89:          simple_global_supervisor/1, hanging_restart_loop/1,
   90: 	 hanging_restart_loop_rest_for_one/1,
   91: 	 hanging_restart_loop_simple/1, code_change/1, code_change_map/1,
   92: 	 code_change_simple/1, code_change_simple_map/1,
   93:          order_of_children/1, scale_start_stop_many_children/1,
   94:          format_log_1/1, format_log_2/1, already_started_outside_supervisor/1,
   95: 	 which_children/1, which_children_simple_one_for_one/1]).
   96: 
   97: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
   98: 
   99: suite() ->
  100:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  101:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
  102: 
  103: all() -> 
  104:     [{group, sup_start}, {group, sup_start_map}, {group, sup_stop}, child_adm,
  105:      child_adm_simple, extra_return, child_specs, child_specs_map, sup_flags,
  106:      multiple_restarts,
  107:      {group, restart_one_for_one},
  108:      {group, restart_one_for_all},
  109:      {group, restart_simple_one_for_one},
  110:      {group, restart_rest_for_one},
  111:      {group, normal_termination},
  112:      {group, shutdown_termination},
  113:      {group, abnormal_termination}, child_unlink, tree,
  114:      {group, significant},
  115:      count_children, count_children_supervisor, count_restarting_children,
  116:      get_callback_module,
  117:      do_not_save_start_parameters_for_temporary_children,
  118:      do_not_save_child_specs_for_temporary_children,
  119:      simple_one_for_one_scale_many_temporary_children, temporary_bystander,
  120:      simple_global_supervisor, hanging_restart_loop,
  121:      hanging_restart_loop_rest_for_one, hanging_restart_loop_simple,
  122:      code_change, code_change_map, code_change_simple, code_change_simple_map,
  123:      order_of_children, scale_start_stop_many_children,
  124:      format_log_1, format_log_2, already_started_outside_supervisor,
  125:      which_children, which_children_simple_one_for_one].
  126: 
  127: groups() -> 
  128:     [{sup_start, [],
  129:       [sup_start_normal, sup_start_ignore_init,
  130:        sup_start_ignore_child, sup_start_ignore_temporary_child,
  131:        sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child,
  132:        sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child_simple,
  133:        sup_start_ignore_permanent_child_start_child_simple,
  134:        sup_start_error_return, sup_start_fail,
  135:        sup_start_child_returns_error, sup_start_restart_child_returns_error,
  136:        sup_start_child_returns_error_simple
  137:       ]},
  138:      {sup_start_map, [],
  139:       [sup_start_map, sup_start_map_simple, sup_start_map_faulty_specs]},
  140:      {sup_stop, [],
  141:       [sup_stop_infinity, sup_stop_timeout, sup_stop_timeout_dynamic,
  142:        sup_stop_brutal_kill, sup_stop_brutal_kill_dynamic,
  143:        sup_stop_race, sup_stop_non_shutdown_exit_dynamic,
  144:        sup_stop_manual, sup_stop_manual_timeout]},
  145:      {normal_termination, [],
  146:       [external_start_no_progress_log, permanent_normal, transient_normal, temporary_normal]},
  147:      {shutdown_termination, [],
  148:       [permanent_shutdown, transient_shutdown, temporary_shutdown,
  149:        faulty_application_shutdown]},
  150:      {abnormal_termination, [],
  151:       [permanent_abnormal, transient_abnormal,
  152:        temporary_abnormal]},
  153:      {restart_one_for_one, [],
  154:       [one_for_one, one_for_one_escalation]},
  155:      {restart_one_for_all, [],
  156:       [one_for_all, one_for_all_escalation,
  157:        one_for_all_other_child_fails_restart]},
  158:      {restart_simple_one_for_one, [],
  159:       [simple_one_for_one, simple_one_for_one_shutdown,
  160:        simple_one_for_one_extra, simple_one_for_one_escalation,
  161:        simple_one_for_one_corruption, simple_one_for_one_restart_ignore]},
  162:      {restart_rest_for_one, [],
  163:       [rest_for_one, rest_for_one_escalation,
  164:        rest_for_one_other_child_fails_restart]},
  165:      {significant, [],
  166:       [nonsignificant_temporary, nonsignificant_transient,
  167:        significant_temporary, significant_transient,
  168:        significant_simple, significant_bystander,
  169:        significant_escalation,
  170:        significant_upgrade_never_any, significant_upgrade_any_never,
  171:        significant_upgrade_never_all, significant_upgrade_all_never,
  172:        significant_upgrade_any_all, significant_upgrade_all_any,
  173:        significant_upgrade_child]}].
  174: 
  175: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  176:     Config.
  177: 
  178: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  179:     ok.
  180: 
  181: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  182:     Config.
  183: 
  184: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  185:     Config.
  186: 
  187: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
  188:     Config.
  189: 
  190: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
  191:     %% Clean up to avoid unnecessary error reports in the shell
  192:     case whereis(sup_test) of
  193:         SupPid when is_pid(SupPid) ->
  194:             unlink(SupPid),
  195:             exit(SupPid,shutdown),
  196:             ok;
  197:         _ ->
  198:             error
  199:     end,
  200:     ok.
  201: 
  202: start_link(InitResult) ->
  203:     supervisor:start_link({local, sup_test}, ?MODULE, InitResult).
  204: 
  205: %% Simulate different supervisors callback.  
  206: init(fail) ->
  207:     erlang:error(fail);
  208: init(InitResult) ->
  209:     InitResult.
  210: 
  211: %% Respect proplist return of supervisor:count_children
  212: get_child_counts(Supervisor) ->
  213:     Counts = supervisor:count_children(Supervisor),
  214:     [proplists:get_value(specs, Counts),
  215:      proplists:get_value(active, Counts),
  216:      proplists:get_value(supervisors, Counts),
  217:      proplists:get_value(workers, Counts)].
  218: 
  219: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  220: %% Test cases starts here.
  221: %% -------------------------------------------------------------------------
  222: %% Tests that the supervisor process starts correctly and that it can
  223: %% be terminated gracefully.
  224: sup_start_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  225:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  226:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  227:     terminate(Pid, shutdown).
  228: 
  229: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  230: %% Tests what happens if init-callback returns ignore.
  231: sup_start_ignore_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  232:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  233:     ignore = start_link(ignore),
  234:     check_no_exit(100).
  235: 
  236: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: %% Tests what happens if init-callback returns ignore.
  238: sup_start_ignore_child(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  239:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  240:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  241:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]}, 
  242: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  243:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  244: 	      1000, worker, []},
  245: 
  246:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  247:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  248: 
  249:     [{child2, CPid2, worker, []},{child1, undefined, worker, []}]
  250: 	= supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  251:     [2,1,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  252: 
  253: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  254: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  255: %% temporary child when ChildSpec is returned directly from supervisor
  256: %% init callback.
  257: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  258: sup_start_ignore_temporary_child(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  259:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  260:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  261: 	      temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  262:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary,
  263: 	      1000, worker, []},
  264:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child1,Child2]}}),
  265: 
  266:     [{child2, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  267:     true = is_pid(CPid2),
  268:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  269: 
  270: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  271: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  272: %% temporary child when child is started with start_child/2.
  273: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  274: sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  275:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  276:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  277:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  278: 	      temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  279:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary,
  280: 	      1000, worker, []},
  281: 
  282:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  283:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  284: 
  285:     [{child2, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  286:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  287: 
  288: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  289: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  290: %% temporary child when child is started with start_child/2, and the
  291: %% supervisor is simple_one_for_one.
  292: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  293: sup_start_ignore_temporary_child_start_child_simple(Config)
  294:   when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  296:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  297: 	      temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  298:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child1]}}),
  299: 
  300:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  301:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  302: 
  303:     [{undefined, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  304:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
  305: 
  306: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  307: %% Tests what happens if child's init-callback returns ignore for a
  308: %% permanent child when child is started with start_child/2, and the
  309: %% supervisor is simple_one_for_one.
  310: %% Child spec shall NOT be saved!!!
  311: sup_start_ignore_permanent_child_start_child_simple(Config)
  312:   when is_list(Config) ->
  313:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  314:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [ignore]},
  315: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  316:     {ok, Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child1]}}),
  317: 
  318:     {ok, undefined} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  319:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  320: 
  321:     [{undefined, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  322:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  323: 
  324:     %% Regression test: check that the supervisor terminates without error.
  325:     exit(Pid, shutdown),
  326:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown).
  327: 
  328: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  329: %% Tests what happens if init-callback returns a invalid value.
  330: sup_start_error_return(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  331:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  332:     %% The bad return is processed in supervisor:init/1
  333:     InitResult = invalid,
  334:     {error, {bad_return, {?MODULE, init, InitResult}}} =
  335:         start_link(InitResult),
  336:     check_no_exit(100).
  337: 
  338: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  339: %% Tests what happens if init-callback fails.
  340: sup_start_fail(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  341:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  342:     %% The exception is processed in gen_server:init_it/2
  343:     ErrorReason = fail,
  344:     {error, {ErrorReason, _Stacktrace}} = start_link(ErrorReason),
  345:     check_no_exit(100).
  346: 
  347: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  348: %% Test what happens when the start function for a child returns
  349: %% {error,Reason} or some other term().
  350: sup_start_restart_child_returns_error(_Config) ->
  351:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  352:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
  353:               permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  354:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  355: 
  356:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  357:     {error,{function_clause,_}} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test,child1),
  358: 
  359:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  363: %% Test what happens when the start function for a child returns
  364: %% {error,Reason} or some other term().
  365: sup_start_child_returns_error(_Config) ->
  366:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  367:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [{return,{error,reason}}]},
  368:               permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  369:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, [{return,error_reason}]},
  370:               permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  371:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  372: 
  373:     {error,{reason,_}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,Child1),
  374:     {error,{error_reason,_}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,Child2),
  375: 
  376:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  377:     ok.
  378: 
  379: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  380: %% Test what happens when the start function for a child returns
  381: %% {error,Reason} - simple_one_for_one
  382: sup_start_child_returns_error_simple(_Config) ->
  383:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  384:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  385:              permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  386:     {ok, _Pid}  = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  387: 
  388:     {error,reason} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,[{return,{error,reason}}]),
  389:     {error,error_reason} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test,[{return,error_reason}]),
  390: 
  391:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  392:     ok.
  393: 
  394: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  395: %% Tests that the supervisor process starts correctly with map
  396: %% startspec, and that the full childspec can be read.
  397: sup_start_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  398:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  399:     Child1 = #{id=>child1, start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []}},
  400:     Child2 = #{id=>child2,
  401: 	       start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  402: 	       shutdown=>brutal_kill},
  403:     Child3 = #{id=>child3,
  404: 	       start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  405: 	       type=>supervisor},
  406:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child1,Child2,Child3]}}),
  407: 
  408:     %% Check default values
  409:     {ok,#{id:=child1,
  410: 	  start:={supervisor_1,start_child,[]},
  411: 	  restart:=permanent,
  412: 	  shutdown:=5000,
  413: 	  type:=worker,
  414: 	  modules:=[supervisor_1]}} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child1),
  415:     {ok,#{id:=child2,
  416: 	  start:={supervisor_1,start_child,[]},
  417: 	  restart:=permanent,
  418: 	  shutdown:=brutal_kill,
  419: 	  type:=worker,
  420: 	  modules:=[supervisor_1]}} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child2),
  421:     {ok,#{id:=child3,
  422: 	  start:={supervisor_1,start_child,[]},
  423: 	  restart:=permanent,
  424: 	  shutdown:=infinity,
  425: 	  type:=supervisor,
  426: 	  modules:=[supervisor_1]}} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child3),
  427:     {error,not_found} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, child4),
  428:     terminate(Pid, shutdown).
  429: 
  430: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  431: %% Tests that the supervisor process starts correctly with map
  432: %% startspec, and that the full childspec can be read when using
  433: %% simple_one_for_one strategy.
  434: sup_start_map_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  435:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  436:     SupFlags = #{strategy=>simple_one_for_one},
  437:     ChildSpec = #{id=>undefined,
  438: 		  start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  439: 		  restart=>temporary},
  440:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {SupFlags, [ChildSpec]}}),
  441: 
  442:     {ok, Child1} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  443:     {ok, Child2} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  444:     {ok, Child3} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  445: 
  446:     Spec = ChildSpec#{type=>worker, shutdown=>5000, modules=>[supervisor_1],
  447: 		      significant=>false},
  448: 
  449:     {ok, Spec} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, Child1),
  450:     {ok, Spec} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, Child2),
  451:     {ok, Spec} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, Child3),
  452:     {error,not_found} = supervisor:get_childspec(Pid, self()),
  453:     terminate(Pid, shutdown).
  454: 
  455: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  456: %% Tests that the supervisor produces good error messages when start-
  457: %% and child specs are faulty.
  458: sup_start_map_faulty_specs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  459:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  460:     Child1 = #{start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []}},
  461:     Child2 = #{id=>child2},
  462:     Child3 = #{id=>child3,
  463: 	       start=>{supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  464: 	       silly_flag=>true},
  465:     Child4 = child4,
  466:     {error,{start_spec,missing_id}} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child1]}}),
  467:     {error,{start_spec,missing_start}} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child2]}}),
  468:     {ok,Pid} = start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child3]}}),
  469:     terminate(Pid,shutdown),
  470:     {error,{start_spec,{invalid_child_spec,child4}}} =
  471: 	start_link({ok, {#{}, [Child4]}}).
  472: 
  473: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  474: %% See sup_stop/1 when Shutdown = infinity, this walue is allowed for
  475: %% children of type supervisor _AND_ worker.
  476: sup_stop_infinity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  477:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  478:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  479:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  480: 	      permanent, infinity, supervisor, []},
  481:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  482: 	      infinity, worker, []},
  483:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  484:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  485:     link(CPid1),
  486:     link(CPid2),
  487: 
  488:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  489:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  490:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, shutdown).
  491: 
  492: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  493: %% See sup_stop/1 when Shutdown = 1000
  494: sup_stop_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  496:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  497:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  498: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  499:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  500: 	      1000, worker, []},
  501:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  502:     link(CPid1),
  503:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  504:     link(CPid2),
  505: 
  506:     CPid2 ! {sleep, 200000},
  507: 
  508:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  509: 
  510:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  511:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, killed).
  512: 
  513: sup_stop_timeout_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  514:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  515:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000, worker, []},
  516:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  517:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  518:     link(CPid1),
  519:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  520:     link(CPid2),
  521:     CPid2 ! {sleep, 200000},
  522:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  523:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  524:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  525:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, killed).
  526: 
  527: 
  528: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  529: %% See sup_stop/1 when Shutdown = brutal_kill
  530: sup_stop_brutal_kill(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  531:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  532:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  533:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  534: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  535:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent,
  536: 	      brutal_kill, worker, []},
  537:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  538:     link(CPid1),
  539:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  540:     link(CPid2),
  541: 
  542:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  543: 
  544:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  545:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, killed).
  546: 
  547: sup_stop_brutal_kill_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  548:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  549:     Child = {child, {supervisor_4, start_child, []}, temporary, brutal_kill, worker, []},
  550:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  551:     CPids = lists:map(
  552:         fun (_) ->
  553:             {ok, CPid} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, []),
  554:             link(CPid),
  555:             CPid
  556:         end,
  557:         lists:seq(1, 10)),
  558:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  559:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  560:     lists:foreach(
  561:         fun (CPid) ->
  562:             check_exit_reason(CPid, killed)
  563:         end,
  564:         CPids
  565:     ).
  566: 
  567: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  568: %% Tests that a supervisor completes its shutdown properly while children
  569: %% exit by themselves for reasons other than shutdown
  570: sup_stop_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  571:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  572:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  573:     {ok, CPidA} = supervisor:start_child(Pid,
  574:         #{id => child_a,
  575:           start => {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  576:           restart => temporary,
  577:           shutdown => 1000}),
  578:     link(CPidA),
  579:     CPids = lists:foldl(
  580:         fun ({Restart, Reason}, Acc) ->
  581:             {ok, CPid} = supervisor:start_child(Pid,
  582:                 #{id => {child, make_ref()},
  583:                   start => {supervisor_4, start_child, [Reason]},
  584:                   restart => Restart,
  585:                   shutdown => 1000
  586:                 }),
  587:             link(CPid),
  588:             Acc#{CPid => Reason}
  589:         end,
  590:         #{},
  591:         [
  592:             {Restart, Reason}
  593:             || Restart <- [temporary, transient, permanent],
  594:                Reason <- [normal, shutdown, {shutdown, test}, other]
  595:         ]
  596:     ),
  597:     {ok, CPidZ} = supervisor:start_child(Pid,
  598:         #{
  599:             id => child_z,
  600:             start => {supervisor_2, start_child, [1000]},
  601:             restart => temporary,
  602:             shutdown => 2000
  603:         }),
  604:     link(CPidZ),
  605:     Self = self(),
  606:     spawn_link(
  607:         fun () ->
  608:             timer:sleep(200),
  609:             maps:foreach(
  610:                 fun (CPid, _) ->
  611:                     CPid ! stop
  612:                 end,
  613:                 CPids
  614:             ),
  615:             unlink(Self)
  616:         end
  617:     ),
  618:     ok = terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  619:     check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  620:     check_exit_reason(CPidZ, shutdown),
  621:     maps:foreach(
  622:         fun (CPid, Reason) ->
  623:             check_exit_reason(CPid, Reason)
  624:         end,
  625:         CPids),
  626:     check_exit_reason(CPidA, shutdown).
  627: 
  628: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  629: %% Tests that a simple_one_for_one supervisor shuts down correctly when
  630: %% some children exit with a reason other than shutdown
  631: sup_stop_non_shutdown_exit_dynamic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  632:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  633:     lists:foreach(
  634:         fun (Restart) ->
  635:             Child = {child, {supervisor_4, start_child, []}, Restart, 5000, worker, []},
  636:             {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  637:             CPids = lists:foldl(
  638:                 fun (Reason, Acc) ->
  639:                     {ok, CPid} = supervisor:start_child(Pid, [Reason]),
  640:                     link(CPid),
  641:                     Acc#{CPid => Reason}
  642:                 end,
  643:                 #{},
  644:                 [normal, shutdown, {shutdown, test}, other]
  645:             ),
  646:             ok = terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  647:             check_exit_reason(Pid, shutdown),
  648:             maps:foreach(
  649:                 fun (CPid, Reason) ->
  650:                     check_exit_reason(CPid, Reason)
  651:                 end,
  652:                 CPids)
  653:         end,
  654:         [temporary, transient, permanent]
  655:     ).
  656: 
  657: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  658: %% Tests that children are shut down when a supervisor is stopped via
  659: %% supervisor:stop/1
  660: %% Since supervisors are gen_servers and the basic functionality of the
  661: %% stop functions is already tested in gen_server_SUITE, we only make
  662: %% sure that children are terminated correctly when applied to a
  663: %% supervisor.
  664: sup_stop_manual(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  665:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  666:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  667:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  668: 	      permanent, brutal_kill, worker, []},
  669:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  670: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  671:     Child3 = {child3, {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  672: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  673:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  674:     link(CPid1),
  675:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  676:     link(CPid2),
  677:     {ok, CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child3),
  678:     link(CPid3),
  679: 
  680:     CPid3 ! {sleep, 100000},
  681: 
  682:     supervisor:stop(Pid),
  683: 
  684:     check_exit_reason(Pid, normal),
  685:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, killed),
  686:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, shutdown),
  687:     check_exit_reason(CPid3, killed).
  688: 
  689: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  690: %% Tests that children are shut down when a supervisor is stopped via
  691: %% supervisor:stop/3, even if the stop call times out.
  692: %% Since supervisors are gen_servers and the basic functionality of the
  693: %% stop functions is already tested in gen_server_SUITE, we only make
  694: %% sure that children are terminated correctly when applied to a
  695: %% supervisor.
  696: sup_stop_manual_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  697:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  698:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  699:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, 
  700: 	      permanent, 5000, worker, []},
  701:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
  702: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  703:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
  704:     link(CPid1),
  705:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
  706:     link(CPid2),
  707: 
  708:     CPid1 ! {sleep, 1000},
  709: 
  710:     try
  711: 	supervisor:stop(Pid, normal, 100)
  712:     of
  713: 	ok -> ct:fail(expected_timeout)
  714:     catch
  715: 	exit:timeout ->
  716: 	    ok
  717:     end,
  718: 
  719:     check_exit_reason(Pid, normal),
  720:     check_exit_reason(CPid1, shutdown),
  721:     check_exit_reason(CPid2, shutdown).
  722: 
  723: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  724: %% The start function provided to start a child may return {ok, Pid}
  725: %% or {ok, Pid, Info}, if it returns the latter check that the
  726: %% supervisor ignores the Info, and includes it unchanged in return
  727: %% from start_child/2 and restart_child/2.
  728: extra_return(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  729:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  730:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [extra_return]}, 
  731: 	     permanent, 1000,
  732: 	     worker, []},
  733:     {ok, _Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  734:     [{child1, CPid, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  735:     link(CPid),
  736:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, hej),
  737:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, hej),
  738:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, hej),
  739:     {error, running} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  740:     {error, running} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  741:     [{child1, CPid, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  742:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  743: 
  744:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  745:     check_exit_reason(CPid, shutdown),
  746:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  747:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  748: 
  749:     {ok, CPid2,extra_return} =
  750: 	supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  751:     [{child1, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  752:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  753: 
  754:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  755:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  756:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  757:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  758:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  759:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  760: 
  761:     {ok, CPid3, extra_return} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  762:     [{child1, CPid3, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  763:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  764: 
  765:     %% Check that it can be automatically restarted
  766:     terminate(CPid3, abnormal),
  767:     [{child1, CPid4, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  768:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  769:     if (not is_pid(CPid4)) orelse CPid4=:=CPid3 ->
  770:             ct:fail({not_restarted,CPid3,CPid4});
  771:        true ->
  772:             ok
  773:     end.
  774: 
  775: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  776: %% Test API functions start_child/2, terminate_child/2, delete_child/2
  777: %% restart_child/2, which_children/1, count_children/1. Only correct
  778: %% childspecs are used, handling of incorrect childspecs is tested in
  779: %% child_specs/1.
  780: child_adm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  781:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  782:     Child = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
  783: 	     worker, []},
  784:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  785: 
  786:     %% Test that supervisors of static nature are hibernated after start
  787:     {current_function, {erlang, hibernate, 3}} =
  788: 	process_info(Pid, current_function),
  789: 
  790:     [{child1, CPid, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  791:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  792:     link(CPid),
  793:     %% Start of an already runnig process 
  794:     {error,{already_started, CPid}} =
  795: 	supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  796: 
  797:     %% Termination
  798:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, hej),
  799:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  800: 	(catch supervisor:terminate_child(foo, child1)),
  801:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  802:     check_exit_reason(CPid, shutdown),
  803:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  804:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  805:     %% Like deleting something that does not exist, it will succeed!
  806:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  807: 
  808:     %% Start of already existing but not running process 
  809:     {error,already_present} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  810: 
  811:     %% Restart
  812:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  813:     [{child1, CPid2, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  814:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  815:     {error, running} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  816:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child2),
  817: 
  818:     %% Deletion
  819:     {error, running} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  820:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, hej),
  821:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  822: 	(catch supervisor:delete_child(foo, child1)),
  823:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  824:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  825:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  826:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  827:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  828: 
  829:     %% Start
  830:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  831: 	(catch supervisor:start_child(foo, Child)),
  832:     {ok, CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child),
  833:     [{child1, CPid3, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  834:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  835: 
  836:     %% Terminate with Pid not allowed when not simple_one_for_one
  837:     {error,not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, CPid3),
  838:     [{child1, CPid3, worker, []}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  839:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  840: 
  841:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call,[foo,which_children,infinity]}}}
  842: 	= (catch supervisor:which_children(foo)),
  843:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call,[foo,count_children,infinity]}}}
  844: 	= (catch supervisor:count_children(foo)),
  845:     ok.
  846: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  847: %% The API functions terminate_child/2, delete_child/2 restart_child/2
  848: %% are not valid for a simple_one_for_one supervisor check that the
  849: %% correct error message is returned.
  850: child_adm_simple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  851:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
  852: 	     worker, []},
  853:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
  854: 
  855:        %% Test that supervisors of dynamic nature are not hibernated after start
  856:     {current_function, {_, Function, _}} =
  857: 	process_info(Pid, current_function),
  858:     true = Function =/= hibernate,
  859: 
  860:     %% In simple_one_for_one all children are added dynamically 
  861:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  862:     [1,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  863: 
  864:     %% Start
  865:     {'EXIT',{noproc,{gen_server,call, _}}} =
  866: 	(catch supervisor:start_child(foo, [])),
  867:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  868:     [{undefined, CPid1, worker, []}] =
  869: 	supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  870:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  871: 
  872:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
  873:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  874:     2 = length(Children),
  875:     true = lists:member({undefined, CPid2, worker, []}, Children),
  876:     true = lists:member({undefined, CPid1, worker, []}, Children),
  877:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  878: 
  879:     %% Termination
  880:     {error, simple_one_for_one} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, child1),
  881:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  882:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test,CPid1),
  883:     [_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  884:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  885:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(CPid1),
  886:     %% Terminate non-existing proccess is ok
  887:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test,CPid1),
  888:     [_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
  889:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
  890:     %% Terminate pid which is not a child of this supervisor is not ok
  891:     NoChildPid = spawn_link(fun() -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  892:     {error, not_found} = supervisor:terminate_child(sup_test, NoChildPid),
  893:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(NoChildPid),
  894: 
  895:     %% Restart
  896:     {error, simple_one_for_one} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
  897: 
  898:     %% Deletion
  899:     {error, simple_one_for_one} = supervisor:delete_child(sup_test, child1),
  900:     ok.
  901: 
  902: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  903: %% Tests child specs (tuple form), invalid formats should be rejected.
  904: child_specs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  905:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  906:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  907:     {error, _} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, hej),
  908: 
  909:     %% Bad child specs 
  910:     B1 = {child, mfa, permanent, 1000, worker, []},
  911:     B2 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, prmanent, 1000, worker, []}, 
  912:     B3 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, -10, worker, []},
  913:     B4 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 10, wrker, []},
  914:     B5 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 1000, worker, dy},
  915:     B6 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 1000, worker, [1,2,3]},
  916: 
  917:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B1),
  918:     {error, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}} =
  919: 	supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B2),
  920:     {error,  {invalid_shutdown,-10}}
  921: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B3),
  922:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
  923: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B4),
  924:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}}
  925: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B5),
  926: 
  927:     {error, {badarg, _}} = supervisor:check_childspecs(B1), % should be list
  928:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B1]),
  929:     {error, {invalid_restart_type,prmanent}} =
  930: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B2]),
  931:     {error, {invalid_shutdown,-10}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B3]),
  932:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
  933: 	= supervisor:check_childspecs([B4]),
  934:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B5]),
  935:     {error, {invalid_module, 1}} =
  936: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B6]),
  937: 
  938:     lists:foreach(
  939: 	fun (ChildSpec) ->
  940: 	    ok = supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec])
  941: 	end,
  942: 	[
  943: 	    {child, {m, f, [a]}, Restart, Shutdown, Type, Modules}
  944: 	    ||
  945: 		Restart <- [permanent, transient, temporary],
  946: 		Shutdown <- [0, 1000, infinity, brutal_kill],
  947: 		Type <- [supervisor, worker],
  948: 		Modules <- [dynamic, [], [m], [m1, m2]]
  949: 	]
  950:     ),
  951: 
  952:     C1 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, infinity, supervisor, []},
  953:     C2 = {child, {m,f,[a]}, permanent, 1000, supervisor, []},
  954: 
  955:     {error,{duplicate_child_name,child}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([C1,C2]),
  956: 
  957:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
  958: 
  959:     %% Faulty child specs in supervisor start
  960:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_mfa, mfa}}} =
  961: 	 start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B1]}}),
  962:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}}} =
  963: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B2]}}),
  964: 
  965:     %% simple_one_for_one needs exactly one child
  966:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[]}} =
  967: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
  968:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[C1,C2]}} =
  969: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [C1,C2]}}),
  970: 
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  974: %% Tests child specs (map form), invalid formats should be rejected.
  975: child_specs_map(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  976:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  977:     {ok, Pid} = start_link({ok, {#{}, []}}),
  978:     {error, _} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, hej),
  979: 
  980:     CS0 = #{id => child, start => {m, f, [a]}},
  981: 
  982:     %% Bad child specs 
  983:     B1 = #{},
  984:     B2 = #{id => child},
  985:     B3 = #{start => {m, f, [a]}},
  986:     B4 = CS0#{start => mfa},
  987:     B5 = CS0#{restart => prmanent}, 
  988:     B6 = CS0#{shutdown => -10},
  989:     B7 = CS0#{type => wrker},
  990:     B8 = CS0#{modules => dy},
  991:     B9 = CS0#{modules => [1,2,3]},
  992:     B10 = CS0#{significant => 'maybe'},
  993: 
  994:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B1),
  995:     {error, missing_start} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B2),
  996:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B3),
  997:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B4),
  998:     {error, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}} =
  999: 	supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B5),
 1000:     {error,  {invalid_shutdown,-10}}
 1001: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B6),
 1002:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
 1003: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B7),
 1004:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}}
 1005: 	= supervisor:start_child(sup_test, B8),
 1006: 
 1007:     {error, {badarg, _}} = supervisor:check_childspecs(B1), % should be list
 1008:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B1]),
 1009:     {error, missing_start} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B2]),
 1010:     {error, missing_id} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B3]),
 1011:     {error, {invalid_mfa,mfa}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B4]),
 1012:     {error, {invalid_restart_type,prmanent}} =
 1013: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B5]),
 1014:     {error, {invalid_shutdown,-10}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B6]),
 1015:     {error, {invalid_child_type,wrker}}
 1016: 	= supervisor:check_childspecs([B7]),
 1017:     {error, {invalid_modules,dy}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([B8]),
 1018:     {error, {invalid_module, 1}} =
 1019: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B9]),
 1020:     {error, {invalid_significant, 'maybe'}} =
 1021: 	supervisor:check_childspecs([B10]),
 1022: 
 1023:     CSFilter = fun (CS) -> maps:filter(fun (_, V) -> V =/= undefined end, CS) end,
 1024:     lists:foreach(
 1025: 	fun
 1026: 	    ({never, ChildSpec = #{significant := true}}) ->
 1027: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
 1028: 		{error, {bad_combination, BadOpts}} =
 1029: 		    supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], never),
 1030: 		[{auto_shutdown, never}, {significant, true}] = lists:sort(BadOpts);
 1031: 	    ({AutoShutdown, ChildSpec = #{restart := undefined, significant := true}}) ->
 1032: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
 1033: 		{error, {bad_combination, BadOpts}} =
 1034: 		    supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], AutoShutdown),
 1035: 		[{restart, permanent}, {significant, true}] = lists:sort(BadOpts);
 1036: 	    ({AutoShutdown, ChildSpec = #{restart := permanent, significant := true}}) ->
 1037: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
 1038: 		{error, {bad_combination, BadOpts}} =
 1039: 		    supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], AutoShutdown),
 1040: 		[{restart, permanent}, {significant, true}] = lists:sort(BadOpts);
 1041: 	    ({AutoShutdown, ChildSpec}) ->
 1042: 		ChildSpec1 = CSFilter(ChildSpec),
 1043: 		ok = supervisor:check_childspecs([ChildSpec1], AutoShutdown)
 1044: 	end,
 1045: 	[
 1046: 	    {AutoShutdown,
 1047: 	     CS0#{restart => Restart,
 1048: 		  shutdown => Shutdown,
 1049: 		  type => Type,
 1050: 		  modules => Modules,
 1051: 		  significant => Significant,
 1052: 		  dummy => Dummy}}
 1053: 	    ||
 1054: 		AutoShutdown <- [undefined, never, any_significant, all_significant],
 1055: 		Restart <- [undefined, permanent, transient, temporary],
 1056: 		Shutdown <- [undefined, 0, 1000, infinity, brutal_kill],
 1057: 		Type <- [undefined, supervisor, worker],
 1058: 		Modules <- [undefined, dynamic, [], [m], [m1, m2]],
 1059: 		Significant <- [undefined, true, false],
 1060: 		Dummy <- [undefined, dummy]
 1061: 	]
 1062:     ),
 1063: 
 1064:     {error,{duplicate_child_name,child}} = supervisor:check_childspecs([CS0,CS0]),
 1065: 
 1066:     terminate(Pid, shutdown),
 1067: 
 1068:     %% Faulty child specs in supervisor start
 1069:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_mfa, mfa}}} =
 1070: 	 start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B4]}}),
 1071:     {error, {start_spec, {invalid_restart_type, prmanent}}} =
 1072: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [B5]}}),
 1073: 
 1074:     %% simple_one_for_one needs exactly one child
 1075:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[]}} =
 1076: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1077:     {error,{bad_start_spec,[CS0,CS0]}} =
 1078: 	start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [CS0,CS0]}}),
 1079: 
 1080:     %% auto_shutdown => never should not accept significant children
 1081:     {error, {start_spec, {bad_combination, _}}} =
 1082: 	start_link({ok, {#{auto_shutdown => never}, [CS0#{significant => true}]}}),
 1083: 
 1084:     ok.
 1085: 
 1086: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1087: %% Test error handling of supervisor flags
 1088: sup_flags(_Config) ->
 1089:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
 1090:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_strategy,_}}} =
 1091: 	start_link({ok, {{none_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1092:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_strategy,_}}} =
 1093: 	start_link({ok, {#{strategy=>none_for_one}, []}}),
 1094:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_intensity,_}}} =
 1095: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, infinity, 3600}, []}}),
 1096:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_intensity,_}}} =
 1097: 	start_link({ok, {#{intensity=>infinity}, []}}),
 1098:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1099: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 0}, []}}),
 1100:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1101: 	start_link({ok, {#{period=>0}, []}}),
 1102:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1103: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, infinity}, []}}),
 1104:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_period,_}}} =
 1105: 	start_link({ok, {#{period=>infinity}, []}}),
 1106:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_auto_shutdown,_}}} =
 1107: 	start_link({ok, {#{auto_shutdown=>sometimes}, []}}),
 1108: 
 1109:     %% SupFlags other than a map or a 3-tuple
 1110:     {error,{supervisor_data,{invalid_type,_}}} =
 1111: 	start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2}, []}}),
 1112: 
 1113:     %% Unexpected flags are ignored
 1114:     {ok,Pid} = start_link({ok,{#{silly_flag=>true},[]}}),
 1115:     terminate(Pid,shutdown),
 1116: 
 1117:     ok.
 1118: 
 1119: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1120: external_start_no_progress_log(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1121:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE, ?MODULE, #{test_case_pid => self()}),
 1122:     Filter = {fun logger_filters:domain/2,{log,sub,[otp,sasl]}},
 1123:     logger:add_handler_filter(?MODULE, filter_non_sasl, Filter),
 1124:     logger:set_module_level([supervisor], info),
 1125:     permanent_normal(Config),
 1126:     receive
 1127:         ok ->
 1128:             ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE);
 1129:         {fail, Msg} ->
 1130:             ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
 1131:             ct:fail({"unexpected progress report", Msg})
 1132:     end.
 1133: 
 1134: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1135: %% A permanent child should always be restarted.
 1136: permanent_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1137:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1138:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1139: 	      worker, []},
 1140:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1141:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1142:     [{child1, Pid ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1143:     case is_pid(Pid) of
 1144: 	true ->
 1145: 	    ok;
 1146: 	false ->
 1147: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1148:     end,
 1149:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1150: 
 1151: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1152: %% A transient child should not be restarted if it exits with reason
 1153: %% normal.
 1154: transient_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1155:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1156:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, transient, 1000,
 1157: 	      worker, []},
 1158: 
 1159:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1160: 
 1161:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1162: 
 1163:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1164:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1165: 
 1166: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1167: %% A temporary process should never be restarted.
 1168: temporary_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1169:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1170:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000,
 1171: 	      worker, []},
 1172: 
 1173:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1174: 
 1175:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1176: 
 1177:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1178:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1179: 
 1180: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1181: %% A permanent child should always be restarted.
 1182: permanent_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1183:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1184:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1185: 	      worker, []},
 1186: 
 1187:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1188: 
 1189:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, shutdown),
 1190: 
 1191:     [{child1, CPid2 ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1192:     case is_pid(CPid2) of
 1193: 	true ->
 1194: 	    ok;
 1195: 	false ->
 1196: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1197:     end,
 1198:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1199: 
 1200:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child1, {shutdown, some_info}),
 1201: 
 1202:     [{child1, CPid3 ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1203:     case is_pid(CPid3) of
 1204: 	true ->
 1205: 	    ok;
 1206: 	false ->
 1207: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1208:     end,
 1209: 
 1210:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1211: 
 1212: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1213: %% A transient child should not be restarted if it exits with reason
 1214: %% shutdown or {shutdown,Term}.
 1215: transient_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1216:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1217:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, transient, 1000,
 1218: 	      worker, []},
 1219: 
 1220:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1221: 
 1222:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, shutdown),
 1223: 
 1224:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1225:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1226: 
 1227:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:restart_child(sup_test, child1),
 1228: 
 1229:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child1, {shutdown, some_info}),
 1230: 
 1231:     [{child1,undefined,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1232:     [1,0,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1233: 
 1234: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1235: %% A temporary process should never be restarted.
 1236: temporary_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1237:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1238:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000,
 1239: 	      worker, []},
 1240: 
 1241:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1242: 
 1243:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, shutdown),
 1244: 
 1245:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1246:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1247: 
 1248:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1249: 
 1250:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child1, {shutdown, some_info}),
 1251: 
 1252:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1253:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1254: 
 1255: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1256: %% Faulty application should shutdown and pass on errors
 1257: faulty_application_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1258: 
 1259:     %% Set some paths
 1260:     AppDir  = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "app_faulty"),
 1261:     EbinDir = filename:join(AppDir, "ebin"),
 1262: 
 1263:     %% Start faulty app
 1264:     code:add_patha(EbinDir),
 1265: 
 1266:     %% {error,
 1267:     %%  {{shutdown,
 1268:     %%    {failed_to_start_child,
 1269:     %% 	app_faulty,
 1270:     %% 	{undef,
 1271:     %% 	 [{an_undefined_module_with,an_undefined_function,[argument1,argument2],
 1272:     %% 	   []},
 1273:     %% 	  {app_faulty_server,init,1,
 1274:     %% 	   [{file,"app_faulty/src/app_faulty_server.erl"},{line,16}]},
 1275:     %% 	  {gen_server,init_it,6,
 1276:     %% 	   [{file,"gen_server.erl"},{line,304}]},
 1277:     %% 	  {proc_lib,init_p_do_apply,3,
 1278:     %% 	   [{file,"proc_lib.erl"},{line,227}]}]}}},
 1279:     %%   {app_faulty,start,[normal,[]]}}}
 1280: 
 1281:     {error, Error} = application:start(app_faulty),
 1282:     {{shutdown, {failed_to_start_child,app_faulty,{undef, CallStack}}},
 1283:      {app_faulty,start,_}} = Error,
 1284:     [{an_undefined_module_with,an_undefined_function,_,_}|_] = CallStack,
 1285:     ok = application:unload(app_faulty),
 1286:     ok.
 1287: 
 1288: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1289: %% A permanent child should always be restarted.
 1290: permanent_abnormal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1291:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1292:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1293: 	      worker, []},
 1294: 
 1295:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1296:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1297: 
 1298:     [{child1, Pid ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1299:     case is_pid(Pid) of
 1300: 	true ->
 1301: 	    ok;
 1302: 	false ->
 1303: 	    ct:fail({permanent_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1304:     end,
 1305:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1306: 
 1307: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1308: %% A transient child should be restarted if it exits with reason abnormal.
 1309: transient_abnormal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1310:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1311:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, transient, 1000,
 1312: 	      worker, []},
 1313: 
 1314:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1315:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1316: 
 1317:     [{child1, Pid ,worker,[]}] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1318:     case is_pid(Pid) of
 1319: 	true ->
 1320: 	    ok;
 1321: 	false ->
 1322: 	    ct:fail({transient_child_not_restarted, Child1})
 1323:     end,
 1324:     [1,1,0,1] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1325: 
 1326: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1327: %% A temporary process should never be restarted.
 1328: temporary_abnormal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1329:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1330:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 1000,
 1331: 	      worker, []},
 1332: 
 1333:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1334:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1335: 
 1336:     [] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1337:     [0,0,0,0] = get_child_counts(sup_test).
 1338: 
 1339: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1340: %% A temporary process killed as part of a rest_for_one or one_for_all
 1341: %% restart strategy should not be restarted given its args are not
 1342: %% saved. Otherwise the supervisor hits its limit and crashes.
 1343: temporary_bystander(_Config) ->
 1344:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 100,
 1345: 	      worker, []},
 1346:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, temporary, 100,
 1347: 	      worker, []},
 1348:     {ok, SupPid1} = supervisor:start_link(?MODULE, {ok, {{one_for_all, 2, 300}, []}}),
 1349:     {ok, SupPid2} = supervisor:start_link(?MODULE, {ok, {{rest_for_one, 2, 300}, []}}),
 1350:     unlink(SupPid1), % otherwise we crash with it
 1351:     unlink(SupPid2), % otherwise we crash with it
 1352:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid1, Child1),
 1353:     {ok, _CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid1, Child2),
 1354:     {ok, CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid2, Child1),
 1355:     {ok, _CPid4} = supervisor:start_child(SupPid2, Child2),
 1356:     terminate(SupPid1, CPid1, child1, normal),
 1357:     terminate(SupPid2, CPid3, child1, normal),
 1358:     timer:sleep(350),
 1359:     catch link(SupPid1),
 1360:     catch link(SupPid2),
 1361:     %% The supervisor would die attempting to restart child2
 1362:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(SupPid1),
 1363:     true = erlang:is_process_alive(SupPid2),
 1364:     %% Child2 has not been restarted
 1365:     [{child1, _, _, _}] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid1),
 1366:     [{child1, _, _, _}] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid2).
 1367: 
 1368: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1369: %% Test restarting a process multiple times, being careful not
 1370: %% to exceed the maximum restart frquency.
 1371: multiple_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1372:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1373:     Child1 = #{id => child1,
 1374: 	       start => {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
 1375: 	       restart => permanent,
 1376: 	       shutdown => brutal_kill,
 1377: 	       type => worker,
 1378: 	       modules => []},
 1379:     SupFlags = #{strategy => one_for_one,
 1380: 		 intensity => 1,
 1381: 		 period => 1},
 1382:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {SupFlags, []}}),
 1383:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1384: 
 1385:     %% Terminate the process several times, but being careful
 1386:     %% not to exceed the maximum restart intensity.
 1387:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1388:     _ = [begin
 1389: 	     receive after 2100 -> ok end,
 1390: 	     [{_, Pid, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1391: 	     terminate(SupPid, Pid, child1, abnormal)
 1392: 	 end || _ <- [1,2,3]],
 1393: 
 1394:     %% Verify that the supervisor is still alive and clean up.
 1395:     ok = supervisor:terminate_child(SupPid, child1),
 1396:     ok = supervisor:delete_child(SupPid, child1),
 1397:     exit(SupPid, kill),
 1398:     ok.
 1399: 
 1400: 
 1401: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1402: %% Test the one_for_one base case.
 1403: one_for_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1404:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1405:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1406: 	      worker, []},
 1407:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1408: 	      worker, []},
 1409:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1410:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1411:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1412: 
 1413:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1414:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1415:     if length(Children) == 2 ->
 1416: 	    case lists:keysearch(CPid2, 2, Children) of
 1417: 		{value, _} -> ok;
 1418: 		_ ->  ct:fail(bad_child)
 1419: 	    end;
 1420:        true ->  ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1421:     end,
 1422:     [2,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1423: 
 1424:     %% Test restart frequency property
 1425:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1426: 
 1427:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1428:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1429:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1430: 
 1431: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1432: %% Test restart escalation on a one_for_one supervisor.
 1433: one_for_one_escalation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1434:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1435: 
 1436:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
 1437: 	      permanent, 1000,
 1438: 	      worker, []},
 1439:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1440: 	      worker, []},
 1441: 
 1442:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_one, 4, 3600}, []}}),
 1443:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1444:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1445:     link(CPid2),
 1446: 
 1447:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1448:     check_exit([SupPid, CPid2]).
 1449: 
 1450: 
 1451: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1452: %% Test the one_for_all base case.
 1453: one_for_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1454:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1455: 
 1456:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1457: 	     worker, []},
 1458:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1459: 	     worker, []},
 1460:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_all, 2, 3600}, []}}),
 1461:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1462:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1463:     link(CPid2),
 1464: 
 1465:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1466:     check_exit([CPid2]),
 1467: 
 1468:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1469:     if length(Children) == 2 -> ok;
 1470:        true ->
 1471: 	    ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1472:     end,
 1473: 
 1474:     %% Test that no old children is still alive
 1475:     not_in_child_list([CPid1, CPid2], lists:map(fun({_,P,_,_}) -> P end, Children)),
 1476: 
 1477:     [2,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1478: 
 1479:     %%% Test restart frequency property
 1480:     [{Id3, Pid3, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1481:     terminate(SupPid, Pid3, Id3, abnormal),
 1482:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1483:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1484:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1485: 
 1486: 
 1487: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1488: %% Test restart escalation on a one_for_all supervisor.
 1489: one_for_all_escalation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1490:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1491: 
 1492:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1493: 	     worker, []},
 1494:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_1, start_child, [error]},
 1495: 	      permanent, 1000,
 1496: 	     worker, []},
 1497:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_all, 4, 3600}, []}}),
 1498:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child1),
 1499:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, Child2),
 1500:     link(CPid2),
 1501: 
 1502:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1503:     check_exit([CPid2, SupPid]).
 1504: 
 1505: 
 1506: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1507: %% Test that the supervisor terminates a restarted child when a different
 1508: %% child fails to start.
 1509: one_for_all_other_child_fails_restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1510:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1511:     Self = self(),
 1512:     Child1 = {child1, {supervisor_3, start_child, [child1, Self]},
 1513: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1514:     Child2 = {child2, {supervisor_3, start_child, [child2, Self]},
 1515: 	      permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1516:     Children = [Child1, Child2],
 1517:     StarterFun = fun() ->
 1518: 	    {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{one_for_all, 3, 3600}, Children}}),
 1519: 	    Self ! {sup_pid, SupPid},
 1520: 	    receive {stop, Self} -> ok end
 1521:     end,
 1522:     StarterPid = spawn_link(StarterFun),
 1523:     Ok = {{ok, undefined}, Self},
 1524:     %% Let the children start.
 1525:     Child1Pid = receive {child1, Pid1} -> Pid1 end,
 1526:     Child1Pid ! Ok,
 1527:     Child2Pid = receive {child2, Pid2} -> Pid2 end,
 1528:     Child2Pid ! Ok,
 1529:     %% Supervisor started.
 1530:     SupPid = receive {sup_pid, Pid} -> Pid end,
 1531:     link(SupPid),
 1532:     exit(Child1Pid, die),
 1533:     %% Let child1 restart but don't let child2.
 1534:     Child1Pid2  = receive {child1, Pid3} -> Pid3 end,
 1535:     Child1Pid2Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Child1Pid2),
 1536:     Child1Pid2 ! Ok,
 1537:     Child2Pid2 = receive {child2, Pid4} -> Pid4 end,
 1538:     Child2Pid2 ! {{stop, normal}, Self},
 1539:     %% Check child1 is terminated.
 1540:     receive
 1541: 	{'DOWN', Child1Pid2Ref, _, _, shutdown} ->
 1542: 	    ok;
 1543: 	{_childName, _Pid} ->
 1544: 	    exit(SupPid, kill),
 1545: 	    check_exit([StarterPid, SupPid]),
 1546: 	    ct:fail({restarting_child_not_terminated, Child1Pid2})
 1547:     end,
 1548:     %% Let the restart complete.
 1549:     Child1Pid3 = receive {child1, Pid5} -> Pid5 end,
 1550:     Child1Pid3 ! Ok,
 1551:     Child2Pid3 = receive {child2, Pid6} -> Pid6 end,
 1552:     Child2Pid3 ! Ok,
 1553:     StarterPid ! {stop, Self},
 1554:     check_exit([StarterPid, SupPid]).
 1555: 
 1556: 
 1557: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1558: %% Test the simple_one_for_one base case.
 1559: simple_one_for_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1560:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1561:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, []}, permanent, 1000,
 1562: 	     worker, []},
 1563:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1564:     {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1565:     {ok, CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1566: 
 1567:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1568: 
 1569:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1570:     if length(Children) == 2 ->
 1571: 	    case lists:keysearch(CPid2, 2, Children) of
 1572: 		{value, _} -> ok;
 1573: 		_ ->  ct:fail(bad_child)
 1574: 	    end;
 1575:        true ->  ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1576:     end,
 1577:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1578: 
 1579:     %% Test restart frequency property
 1580:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1581: 
 1582:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1583: 
 1584:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1585:     check_exit_reason(SupPid,shutdown).
 1586: 
 1587: 
 1588: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1589: %% Test simple_one_for_one children restarts and returning ignore.
 1590: simple_one_for_one_restart_ignore(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1591:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1592:     Self = self(),
 1593:     lists:foreach(
 1594:         fun(Restart) ->
 1595:             Child = {child, {supervisor_3, start_child, []}, Restart, 1000, worker, []},
 1596:             {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 10, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1597:             StarterPid1 = spawn_link(fun() -> supervisor:start_child(SupPid, [child1, Self]) end),
 1598:             ChildPid1 = receive {child1, CPid1} -> CPid1 end,
 1599:             ChildPid1 ! {{ok, 0}, Self},
 1600:             check_exit([StarterPid1]),
 1601:             [{undefined, ChildPid1, _, _}] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid),
 1602:             terminate(ChildPid1, kill),
 1603:             ChildPid2 = receive {child1, CPid2} -> CPid2 end,
 1604:             ChildPid2 ! {{ok, 0}, Self},
 1605:             [{undefined, ChildPid2, _, _}] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid),
 1606:             terminate(ChildPid2, kill),
 1607:             ChildPid3 = receive {child1, CPid3} -> CPid3 end,
 1608:             ChildPid3 ! {ignore, Self},
 1609:             [] = supervisor:which_children(SupPid),
 1610:             terminate(SupPid, shutdown),
 1611:             ok = check_exit_reason(SupPid, shutdown)
 1612:         end,
 1613:         [transient, permanent]
 1614:     ).
 1615: 
 1616: 
 1617: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1618: %% Test simple_one_for_one children shutdown accordingly to the
 1619: %% supervisor's shutdown strategy.
 1620: simple_one_for_one_shutdown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1621:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1622:     ShutdownTime = 1000,
 1623:     Child = {child, {supervisor_2, start_child, []},
 1624:              permanent, 2*ShutdownTime, worker, []},
 1625:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1626: 
 1627:     %% Will be gracefully shutdown
 1628:     {ok, _CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [ShutdownTime]),
 1629:     {ok, _CPid2} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [ShutdownTime]),
 1630: 
 1631:     %% Will be killed after 2*ShutdownTime milliseconds
 1632:     {ok, _CPid3} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [5*ShutdownTime]),
 1633: 
 1634:     {T, ok} = timer:tc(fun terminate/2, [SupPid, shutdown]),
 1635:     if T < 1000*ShutdownTime ->
 1636:             %% Because supervisor's children wait before exiting, it can't
 1637:             %% terminate quickly
 1638:             ct:fail({shutdown_too_short, T});
 1639:        T >= 1000*5*ShutdownTime ->
 1640:             ct:fail({shutdown_too_long, T});
 1641:        true ->
 1642:             check_exit([SupPid])
 1643:     end.
 1644: 
 1645: 
 1646: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1647: %% Tests automatic restart of children who's start function return
 1648: %% extra info.
 1649: simple_one_for_one_extra(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1650:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1651:     Child = {child, {supervisor_1, start_child, [extra_info]}, 
 1652: 	     permanent, 1000, worker, []},
 1653:     {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1654:     {ok, CPid1, extra_info} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1655:     {ok, CPid2, extra_info} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1656:     link(CPid2),
 1657:     terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1658:     Children = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1659:     if length(Children) == 2 ->
 1660: 	    case lists:keysearch(CPid2, 2, Children) of
 1661: 		{value, _} -> ok;
 1662: 		_ ->  ct:fail(bad_child)
 1663: 	    end;
 1664:        true ->  ct:fail({bad_child_list, Children})
 1665:     end,
 1666:     [1,2,0,2] = get_child_counts(sup_test),
 1667:     terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1668:     [{Id4, Pid4, _, _}|_] = supervisor:which_children(sup_test),
 1669:     terminate(SupPid, Pid4, Id4, abnormal),
 1670:     check_exit([SupPid]).
 1671: 
 1672: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1673: %% Test for subtle corruption of internal state for a
 1674: %% simple_one_for_one supervisor. Thanks to Zeyu Zhang (@zzydxm) and
 1675: %% Maxim Fedorov for noticing this bug. (OTP-16804)
 1676: simple_one_for_one_corruption(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1677:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1678: 
 1679:     logger:add_handler(?MODULE, ?MODULE, #{test_case_pid => self()}),
 1680: 
 1681:     try
 1682:         Child = #{id => child, start => {supervisor_1, start_child, []},
 1683:                   restart => temporary, shutdown => 1000,
 1684:                   type => worker, modules => []},
 1685:         {ok, SupPid} = start_link({ok, {{simple_one_for_one, 2, 3600}, [Child]}}),
 1686:         {ok, CPid1} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, []),
 1687: 
 1688:         terminate(SupPid, CPid1, child1, abnormal),
 1689: 
 1690:         %% The first time a child of simple_one_for_one supervisor
 1691:         %% with restart strategy `temporary` dies, the internal state
 1692:         %% for the supervisor will become inconsistent (the `dynamics`
 1693:         %% field would change from `{mapsets,Map}` to
 1694:         %% `{maps,Map}`). That inconsistency will make the supervisor
 1695:         %% retain the start arguments even for temporary processes.
 1696:         %%
 1697:         %% To test that the bug is fixed, start a new child process
 1698:         %% with a large term in its argument list.
 1699: 
 1700:         N = 50000,
 1701:         BigData = binary_to_list(<<0:N/unit:8>>),
 1702:         {ok, CPid2, BigData} = supervisor:start_child(sup_test, [BigData]),
 1703: 
 1704:         %% Since the child is temporary, the supervisor should not keep
 1705:         %% the argument list for the child and the supervisor's heap
 1706:         %% size should shrink after a GC.
 1707: 
 1708:         true = erlang:garbage_collect(SupPid),
 1709:         {total_heap_size, HeapSize} = process_info(SupPid, total_heap_size),
 1710:         if
 1711:             HeapSize > 2*N ->
 1712:                 %% The start arguments for the child have been kept.
 1713:                 ct:fail({excessive_heap_size,HeapSize});
 1714:             true ->
 1715:                 ok
 1716:         end,
 1717: 
 1718:         terminate(SupPid, CPid2, child2, abnormal),
 1719: 
 1720:         exit(SupPid, kill)
 1721:     after
